definition: colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: All the lamps were soft and misty and made a very tiny circle of light.
sentences.chinese: 所有的落地燈都只有一小圈柔和模糊的光。

sentences.english: If use marble lamp or floor lamp, the effect will be better.
sentences.chinese: 如使用雲石燈或落地燈，效果會更好。

sentences.english: The fortuny floor lamp is from design within reach.
sentences.chinese: 落地燈是由可以實現的設計圖設計的。

sentences.english: The other a side of the bed is putting one person's much taller floor lamp .
sentences.chinese: 牀的另一側擺放着一人多高的落地燈。

sentences.english: Clever floor lamp designed for the fans of the risks and thrills.
sentences.chinese: 爲喜歡探險和刺激的人而設計的靈巧落地燈。

sentences.english: The special purpose of floor lamp?
I find that shape is an important feature in floor lamps.
sentences.chinese: 我發現落地燈的形狀很重要。
